Theory Reference#

The Theory section gathers background material that underpins lib-ela. It blends concise derivations with hands-on code so you can move seamlessly from equations to executable examples. Use this section when you need to check a tensor identity, confirm a stress measure, or dig into an energy function.

Hyperelasticity#

Kinematics, strain-energy functions, stress measures, and consistent tangents for large-strain elasticity.

→ Read the guide: Hyperelasticity Theory & Derivation

Material-Model Catalogue#

Closed-form expressions, parameter lists, and validity ranges for every energy model implemented in lib-ela.

→ Browse models: Material Model Catalogue

Deformation Protocols#

Most constitutive tests reduce to a handful of canonical load cases— uniaxial, biaxial, simple shear, and volumetric/hydrostatic. We formalise each as a deformation protocol with an analytic deformation-gradient tensor \(\mathbf{F}\).

→ Browse tests: Deformation Protocols
